DOC.brief_summary: The trial 12-week phase 2 study . Subjects give subcutaneous injection week 0 ( 160mg ) , 2 ( 80mg ) , every week ( 40mg ) week 12 subject moderate severe hidradenitis suppurativa .
DOC.brief_title: To Assess Efficacy Safety Adalimumab Subjects With Moderate Severe Hidradenitis Suppurativa
DOC.criteria: Subjects moderate severe HS define HSSI > 8 AND least ONE following : 1 . HS > 1 year duration multiple ER doctor visit relate HS 2 . Intralesional kenalog injection > 5/year , however none within 2 week entry 3 . Failed systemic retinoids , within 3 month entry 4 . Failed least one prior course antibiotic therapy , must administer within 2 week entry study ( exclude recommend antibiotic regimen give evidence active infection immediately enrollment ) 5 . History surgery ( reconstructive ) , within 3 month entry 1 . Women pregnant , nursing , plan pregnancy within 6 month last injection ( include father 's plan father child within 6 month last injection ) . 2 . Use systemic antiinflammatory medication except NSAIDs low dose systemic steroid ( equal less 10 mg daily prednisolone equivalent ) . 3 . If find active infection , patient must complete topical oral antibiotic therapy least 7 day first injection . 4 . Have know history serious infection ( e.g. , hepatitis , pneumonia pyelonephritis ) previous 3 month . 5 . Have opportunistic infection ( e.g. , herpes zoster [ shingle ] , cytomegalovirus , Pneumocystis carinii , aspergillosis , histoplasmosis , mycobacteria TB ) within 6 month prior screen . 6 . Have history lymphoproliferative disease , include lymphoma sign suggestive possible lymphoproliferative disease lymphadenopathy unusual size location ( e.g. , node posterior triangle neck , infraclavicular , epitrochlear , periaortic area ) , splenomegaly . 7 . Have concomitant diagnosis history congestive heart failure . 8 . Have history latent active granulomatous infection , include TB , histoplasmosis , coccidioidomycosis , prior screen .
